slides.title: Albert Einstein
slides.description: Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance, you must keep moving.

slides.title: Mahatma Gandhi
slides.description: Be the change that you wish to see in the world.

slides.title: Oscar Wilde
slides.description: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.

slides.title: Nelson Mandela
slides.description: It always seems impossible until it’s done.

slides.title: Confucius
slides.description: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.

slides.title: Mark Twain
slides.description: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.

slides.title: Eleanor Roosevelt
slides.description: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.

slides.title: Steve Jobs
slides.description: Your time is limited, so don’t waste it living someone else’s life.

slides.title: Abraham Lincoln
slides.description: Whatever you are, be a good one.

slides.title: Aristotle
slides.description: We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit.

slides.title: Helen Keller
slides.description: The best and most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or even touched — they must be felt with the heart.

slides.title: Sun Tzu
slides.description: In the midst of chaos, there is also opportunity.

slides.title: Henry Ford
slides.description: Whether you think you can, or you think you can’t — you’re right.

slides.title: Socrates
slides.description: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.

slides.title: Winston Churchill
slides.description: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.

slides.title: Ralph Waldo Emerson
slides.description: Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.

slides.title: Leonardo da Vinci
slides.description: Simplicity is the ultimate sophistication.

slides.title: Mother Teresa
slides.description: Not all of us can do great things. But we can do small things with great love.

slides.title: Plato
slides.description: The beginning is the most important part of the work.

slides.title: Benjamin Franklin
slides.description: Tell me and I forget. Teach me and I remember. Involve me and I learn.
